intro: Antirrhinum appendiculatum, commonly known as the appendiculate snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Plantaginaceae and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to yellow. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry habitats, showcasing its adaptability to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Antirrhinum appendiculatum is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
